ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: they said, 'Why should we believe you when the vilest people follow you?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They said: "Should we place our trust in you when only the condemned follow you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They answered: "Shall we accept you even though it is the meanest of people who follow you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They said, "Should we believe in you when no one has followed you except the lowest ones".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They said, “Shall we believe in you, whereas the abject people are with you?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They said: "Shall we believe in you, when the inferior follow you"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They said: Shall we believe in you while the meanest follow you?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: They said, 'Shall we believe thee, whom the vilest follow?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They said: Shall we put faith in thee, when the lowest (of the people) follow thee?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They replied, "Are we to believe in you when your followers are but the lowest of the low?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They said: shall We believe in thee when the meanest follow thee?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They said, ‘Shall we believe in you, when it is the riffraff who follow you?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They said: "Shall we believe in thee when it is the meanest that follow thee?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They said: "Shall we believe in you, when the meanest (of the people) follow you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: They replied: 'Are we to believe you whom the lowliest follow'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They said, “Shall we believe in you, when it is the lowliest who follow you?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:111] They said, ‘Shall we believe in you, in your words, when it is the lowliest people who follow you?’ (wa’ttaba‘aka: a variant reading has wa-atbā‘uka, ‘[when] your followers’, plural of tābi‘, ‘follower’, as a subject) the riffraff, such as the weavers and the shoemakers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They said: Shall we put faith in thee) shall we believe in you, O Noah, (when the lowest (of the people) follow thee) when our most lowly and weak have followed you? We will not believe in you until you repulse them.
